title: Interferometric binary phase estimations
authors: Simone Roncallo, Xi Lu, Lorenzo Maccone
abstract:
We propose an interferometric setup where each photon returns one bit of the
binary expansion of an unknown phase. It sets up a method for estimating the
phase value at arbitrary uncertainty. This strategy is global, since it
requires no prior information, and it achieves the Heisenberg bound
independently of the output statistics. We provide simulations and a
characterization of this architecture.
